text:
How to get (instantly) better ChatGPT answers:

1. Don't ask for results. Ask for questions.

☑ “Before you answer, ask ≤3 clarifying questions.”
☑ If info is missing, pause & ask, state assumptions.
☑ Use "Deep Research" to get questions.

2. Use ChatGPT to make ChatGPT prompts.

☑ ChatGPT's Prompt maker: https://lnkd.in/ePWMRiKn 
☑ Write your bad prompt, get a better prompt.
☑ Make sure to use the "Thinking" model.

3. Give a brief, not a wish.

☑ Role + audience + goal + constraints.
☑ 1–2 gold examples + 1 anti-example.
☑ Expectations: format, length, tone, iteration.

4. Iterate in small loops.

☑ Step 1: options/angles → you pick.
☑ Step 2: draft → you critique → revise.
☑ Step 3: final pass with acceptance tests.

5. Define “done.”

☑ List 3 success criteria (measurable).
☑ List 3 must-nots (claims, buzzwords, clichés).
☑ “Stop and ask if criteria can’t be met.”

6. Lock the output format.

☑ Number sections; no preamble or fluff.
☑ Provide a mini template or JSON schema.
☑ One screen max (or specify word/bullet limits).

7. Force trade-offs.

☑ “Propose 3 approaches; rank against [metric].”
☑ “Pick the winner and justify in 2 lines.”
☑ “Proceed with the winner only.”

8. Ground in facts.

☑ “Use 2–3 credible sources; cite inline.”
☑ Prefer primary docs over summaries.
☑ Flag unknowns explicitly; don’t invent.

9. Control style tightly.

☑ Give a style block (voice, reading grade, rhythm).
☑ Include 3 must-use phrases + a banned list.
☑ “Match style exactly; if unsure, ask first.”

10. Feed your own data.

☑ “Prefer these patterns; adapt to context.”
☑ Paste 3 samples of your best work.
☑ Label what to mimic/avoid.
